summary: Sulfur is a bright yellow, solid element often found in nature as a yellow mineral. It is common on Earth and is essential for life. Sulfur is used in many ways, like making fertilizers and chemicals, and it's even in some foods and vitamins. Ancient people knew about sulfur, using it for various purposes. Today, we get most sulfur from natural gas and oil. Its smelly compounds can be found in things like rotten eggs and skunk spray.
title: Sulfur
